body.p: Which of the following is not correct about descending tracts of the spinal columns?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is correct about the various descending tracts in the spinal columns; ascending tracts carry sensory signals.
Correct. All tracts are white matter in the columns or funiculi of the spinal cord.
Incorrect. This is correct about descending tracts in the spinal column; they can go to skeletal, smooth or cardiac muscle.
Incorrect. This is correct about descending tracts in the spinal column; ascending carry input from receptors to brain.
Incorrect. This is correct about descending tracts coming from the brain; ascending tracts carry signals superiorly to brain.

part.hint: The ascending and descending tracts have different functions although found together in the anterior, posterior and lateral white columns.

body.p: Which of the following would be a descending spinal tract?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is ascending carrying impulses to the thalamus of the brain.
Correct. This originates in the reticular region of the brain.
Incorrect. This is ascending carrying impulses to the reticular region of the brain.
Incorrect. This is sensory so ascending and ends in a gray matter area of the medulla oblongata.
Incorrect. This is sensory so ascending, and ends in a gray matter area of the medulla oblongata.

part.hint: The name of the many of the tracts combines the origin and location, so the first part of a descending tract name would be part of the brain while the second part of an ascending tract would be a part of the brain. For other sensory tracts, the name describes its shape (e.g. cuneate means wedge and gracile means slender).

body.p: The posterior root ganglion contains what?

response.feedback: Correct. These unipolar neurons send sensory impulses from peripheral receptors to interneurons of the posterior horn.
Incorrect. These neuron cell bodies are located in the posterior horn of the spinal cord.
Incorrect. These neuron cell bodies originate in the cerebrum or brainstem.
Incorrect. These neuron cell bodies are located in the anterior horn of the spinal cord.
Incorrect. These cell bodies are located either in the lateral horn of the spinal cord or sympathetic ganglia.

part.hint: Ganglia contain neuron cell bodies outside the central nervous system.
